p: Finally, additional pressure in several regions of projected reductions in river dilution capacity ties pollution control to basin-scale water management 16 27 and climate adaptation 20 28, making dialogues with provincial and national governments as well as international cooperation important 29. Any measures that increase freshwater availability may help here, such as reservoir releases and conjunctive use. Making water available for pollution control competes with several other water users and thus a proper balance needs to be found that considers all stakeholders.
